title: 114_hr3649
content: Establishment of units of the National Guard in the Northern Mariana Islands. Title 32 (National Guard) Amendments include changes to definitions and branches to include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands along with Puerto Rico. Title 32 (National Guard) Amendments now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands along with Puerto Rico in various sections of the United States Code. Title 32 (National Guard) Amendments now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in various sections of the United States Code, alongside Puerto Rico. Amendments involve maintenance of troops, drug interdiction, enlistment oath, and adjutants general. Amendments to Title 32 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands alongside Puerto Rico in various sections, such as adjutants general, detail of regular members, termination of appointment, and relief from national guard duty when ordered to active duty. Amendments to Title 32 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands alongside Puerto Rico in various sections related to courts-martial and governor's authority. Amendments to Title 32 of the United States Code include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands alongside Puerto Rico in sections related to governor's authority, training operations, training missions, and participation in field exercises. Amendments to Title 32 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands alongside Puerto Rico in various sections related to National Guard schools, attendance at army and air force schools, and the National Guard youth challenge program. Amendments to Title 32 of the United States Code include adding the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands alongside Puerto Rico in sections related to supplies and purchases from the army or air force. Amendments to Title 32 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in sections related to accountability, property and fiscal officers, employment, use, and status of technicians. Amendments to Title 32 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in sections related to accountability for property issued to the national guard, disposition of obsolete or condemned property, disposition of proceeds of condemned stores issued to national guard, and settlements for property loss, personal injury, or death. Amendments to Title 32 of the United States Code expand coverage to include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in various sections related to property accountability and settlements for loss or death. Amendments to Title 32 of the United States Code include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in various sections related to property accountability and settlements for loss or death. This involves changes in sections related to militia duty exemptions, articles of uniform, and other provisions. Amendments to Title 10 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in military powers of attorney, advance medical directives, and details of army and air national guard assignments. Amendments to Title 10 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in military powers of attorney, advance medical directives, and details of army and air national guard assignments. Additionally, the amendments involve the training of military technicians in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. Amendments to Title 10 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in military powers of attorney, advance medical directives, and details of army and air national guard assignments. This also involves the training of military technicians in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. The amendments extend to commissioned officers' original appointments and organizing reserve components in Puerto Rico and the Northern Mariana Islands. Amendments to Title 10 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in military powers of attorney, advance medical directives, and details of army and air national guard assignments. This also involves the training of military technicians in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. The amendments extend to commissioned officers' original appointments and organizing reserve components in Puerto Rico and the Northern Mariana Islands. The changes in the code now include the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in various military provisions and definitions. The amendments to Title 10 of the United States Code now include the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in various military provisions and definitions.
